title: Markdown: minimize list of chars escaped for HTML output
body: Now matches CommonMark. Fixes 38 CommonMark spec tests.

files.patch:
@@ -22,19 +22,8 @@ end
 
 tag(io::IO, tag, attrs...) = withtag(nothing, io, tag, attrs...)
 
-const _htmlescape_chars = Dict('<'=>"<",   '>'=>">",
-                               '"'=>""", '&'=>"&",
-                               # ' '=>" ",
-                               )
-for ch in "'`!\$%()=+{}[]"
-    _htmlescape_chars[ch] = "&#$(Int(ch));"
-end
-
 function htmlesc(io::IO, s::AbstractString)
-    # s1 = replace(s, r"&(?!(\w+|\#\d+);)" => "&")
-    for ch in s
-        print(io, get(_htmlescape_chars, ch, ch))
-    end
+    replace(io, s, '<'=>"<", '>'=>">", '"'=>""", '&'=>"&")
 end
 function htmlesc(io::IO, s::Symbol)
     htmlesc(io, string(s))

@@ -390,7 +390,7 @@ end h2 --- not - == =""" |> html == "

h1

\n

h2

\n

not == =

\n" + == =""" |> html == "

h1

\n

h2

\n

not == =

\n" end @testset "the 'book' example input" begin @@ -556,7 +556,7 @@ end sum_ref = md"Behaves like $(Reference1(sum))" @test Markdown.plain(sum_ref) == "Behaves like sum (see Julia docs)\n" - @test Markdown.html(sum_ref) == "

Behaves like sum (see Julia docs)

\n" + @test Markdown.html(sum_ref) == "

Behaves like sum (see Julia docs)

\n" @testset "JuliaLang/julia#59783 and #53362" begin x = 1 @@ -598,7 +598,7 @@ end Markdown.withtag(io, :a, :href=>"test") do Markdown.htmlesc(io, Markdown.plaininline(r)) end - @test Markdown.html(sum_ref) == "

Behaves like sum (see Julia docs)

\n" + @test Markdown.html(sum_ref) == "

Behaves like sum (see Julia docs)

\n" end @testset "GH tables" begin @@ -936,7 +936,7 @@ end

custom title

Bar

-

!!!

+

!!!

""" @test actual == expected @@ -1480,23 +1480,23 @@ end """

  • code block inside a list with more than one blank line with indentation works

    - 
    domaths(x::Number) = x + 5
+    
    domaths(x::Number) = x + 5
 
 
-    domath(x::Int) = x + 10
    
+    domath(x::Int) = x + 10

  • another entry, now testing code blocks without fences

    # this is a code block
-    x = 1 + 1
+    x = 1 + 1
 
 
-    # Two empty lines don't interrupt the code
-    y = x * 3
    + # Two empty lines don't interrupt the code + y = x * 3

  • a final list entry

-

And now to something completely different!

+

And now to something completely different!

""" @test expected == Markdown.html(md)
